intro: Scrophularia marginata, commonly known as the purple foxglove, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of tubular, purplish-pink flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
